com.magnet.async

Class AsyncCallOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.magnet.async.AsyncCallOptions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Options

    @Contract
public abstract class AsyncCallOptions
extends Object
implements Options
    Options for an asynchronous call. An asynchronous call allows the caller to use the cached value, to impose a restriction when the call can be invoked, and to specify a callback listener. Caller must use create() to create an instance of the options.

    For mobile clients, these types of options are only applicable when the user is seen as "online" and connected to the server. If you wish to submit operations while in an "offline" state, or there is a need for more reliable long-lasting durable operations then use ReliableCallOptions instead.

    If no options are specified, async (unreliable) call options are assumed.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static AsyncCallOptions create()
        Create an instance of asynchronous call options.
        Returns:
        An instance of an AsyncCallOptions object.

      • setConstraint

        public abstract AsyncCallOptions setConstraint(Class<? extends Constraint> constraint)
        Specify a constraint that a call must meet before it can be processed. Invoke the call only when this constraint condition is met. This will retry the async operation periodically, or when network and/or constraint conditions have changed. It will not, however, survive restarts of the application. Use ReliableCallOptions if that is desired.

        Example: 

           AsyncCallOptions options = AsyncCallOptions.create();
   options.setStateListener(new StateListener {
     public void onStateChanged(Call call) {
     ...
     }
   }).setCacheAge(1, TimeUnit.HOURS, true).setConstraint(WifiConstraint.class));
   mAsyncMyController.getLocalizedCategories(..., options);
        Parameters:
        constraint - Any class extends from Constraint.
        Returns:
        The current instance.

      • setCacheAge

        public abstract AsyncCallOptions setCacheAge(long age,
                           TimeUnit unit,
                           boolean ignoreAgeIfOffline)
        Enable caching of the result and set an acceptable age of the previously cached value. This option will always attempt to use the cached value (if available) whose cache age is within the age interval during online mode. During offline mode, if ignoreAgeIfOffline is true, the cached value will always be used despite of its age; otherwise, if the cached value is too old, the cache will be discarded and the new result from the server will be cached. If this option is not specified, the cached value will be discarded and the new result will not be cached. By specifying 0 age, it is same as refreshing the result.
        Parameters:
        age - 0 to discard the cached value, > 0 to specify the acceptable cache age
        unit - Time unit.
        ignoreAgeIfOffline - true to always use cached value if offline. This parameter is ignored during online mode.
        Returns:
        The current instance.

      • setToken

        public abstract AsyncCallOptions setToken(String token)
        Specify an optional opaque custom token for this call. The token serves as a user specified opaque token for informational purposes only. It is not used internally by the platform. This is useful in cases where you want to relate any callback listener to the call that was submitted.
        Parameters:
        token - A user specified string.
        Returns:
        The current instance.

      • setStateListener

        public abstract AsyncCallOptions setStateListener(StateListener listener)
        Set a transient listener for this async call. The listener will be run in the UI thread.

        Example: 

           AsyncCallOptions options = AsyncCallOptions.create();
   options.setStateListener(new CallListener {
     public void onStateChanged(Call call) {
     ...
     }
   });
   mAsyncMyController.getLocalizedCategories(..., options);
        Parameters:
        listener - An instance of StateListener.
        Returns:
        The current instance.
